lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your report on the California Supreme Court ruling to allow the Boy Scouts of America to exclude homosexuals, agnostics and atheists from its ranks quotes Chief Justice Ronald George's opinion that ''scouts meet regularly in small groups (often in private homes) that are intended to foster close friendship, trust and loyalty'' (news article, March 24). This statement implies that gay people cannot foster or possess such virtuous traits, or would be likely to undermine them.
abstract: Letter from Philip Bockman scores California Supreme Court ruling allowing Boy Scouts to exclude homosexuals, agnostics and atheists from its ranks (S)
